greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: n-th prime prime(n) written in base (prime(n) (mod prime(n-1))).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..62 (a(63) needs digits > 9)
example: Eventually non-decimal digit symbols appear, as in case of 307=17d, in base 14 = 307 mod 293.
maple: a:= proc(n) local b, p, l;
else l:= ""; while p>0 do l:= irem(p, b, 'p'), l od
program: (PARI) a(n) = {my(p=prime(n), q=prime(n-1)); if ((p % q) != 1, d=digits(p, p % q); if (#select(x->(x>9), d), 0, fromdigits(d, 10)), fromdigits(vector(p, k, 1), 10));} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 05 2019
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 12 2002
